page.title: 09EARLY HEATED TOMATOES
page.content: 12,000 plants are grown under glass. The yield is about 150 tons per acre. Seeds are sown in November in a growing room.Then they are pricked out into 3"pots.After 3 weeksthey are placed on top of peat bags in the greenhouses,and planted after 6 weeks. Each plant is drained up 30ft strings. As they grow the bottom leaves side shoot dead trusses are taken off.When they read the wire they are layered so that the stems end up trailing on the ground.The first flowers appear in January and they are pollinated daily with an electric bee.Picking starts at the begining of March and finishes in November when all the plants are cleared and the greenhouse sterilised. The nursery is called the Paget Nursery.
